meanings.definition: To work at anything in an irregular or superficial manner
meanings.sent1: She dabbles in painting, trying different colors and styles.
meanings.sent2: He dabbles in gardening, planting a few flowers here and there.
meanings.sent3: The cat dabbles with the yarn, not really interested in knitting.
meanings.sent4: Her mind dabbles in thoughts of travel, dreaming of far-off lands.
meanings.sent5: The child dabbles with the puzzle, moving pieces around aimlessly.

meanings.definition: To play and splash in water
meanings.sent1: The kids dabble in the pool, laughing and splashing each other.
meanings.sent2: The puppy dabbles in the puddle, wagging its tail happily.
meanings.sent3: The duck dabbles in the pond, quacking joyfully as it swims.
meanings.sent4: The otter dabbles in the stream, sliding and diving with grace.
meanings.sent5: The children dabble in the fountain, enjoying the cool water on a hot day.

meanings.definition: To dip, paddle, or sprinkle in water or other liquid
meanings.sent1: She dabbles her feet in the ocean, feeling the waves tickle her toes.
meanings.sent2: He dabbles the brush in the paint, mixing colors for his artwork.
meanings.sent3: The chef dabbles the spoon in the sauce, tasting it for seasoning.
meanings.sent4: The bird dabbles its beak in the stream, sipping water delicately.
meanings.sent5: The child dabbles the toy boat in the bathtub, creating ripples in the water.
